SENT.plain: Dicentric chromosomes can occur in myelodysplastic syndromes and acute myeloid leukemia
As these unbalanced rearrangements often combine two recurrent deletions, they could be an efficient mechanism for the loss of two tumor suppressor genes in a single step

We report here that dicentric chromosomes involving chromosome 20 with loss of the 20q12 putative tumor suppressor gene are often the result of more complex rearrangements, with the 20q12 region being lost by an interstitial deletion independent of the site of translocation
We found interstitial deletions of 20q in two thirds of the two-way translocations tested

This points to a more complex mechanism of translocation involving at least three breakpoints and two separate events, and raises questions about the order of these events and the significance of these abnormalities
